messageBody:
Simon Chappell wrote:
> On 8/25/06, Greg Irvine <greg.irvine@...> wrote:
>> Any suggestions on how I might count the total number of test failures and
>> errors in a build in order to fail the build at a certain threshold rather
>> than more 0 failures?
>
> No idea. You have the code, dive in and code up a storm. :-)
>
>> The <junit> task seems to only set a fail/error property and not the number
>> of failures in a test case.

I haven't made these changes myself, but I have poked around the 3.8.1
codebase to do something similar. What I think you have to do is:

1. Modify or subclass junit.framework.TestResult's wasSuccessful() to
check the failure and error counts against your specified threshold.
2. If you're using one of the junit.*ui.TestRunners, modify or subclass
createTestResult() to return your TestResult subclass, if necessary.
TestRunner.doRun() takes this TestResult object and passes it to a
TestSuite's run(), which accumulates the failures and errors in the
TestResult.
3. If you're using a runner in an IDE, you're on your own. CLI all the
way! :)
